description.title: pedal assembly : precautions for the repair

descmetadata.siename: pedal assembly : precautions for the repair

noteR.para: To avoid breaking the connection between the brake servo pushrod and the brake pedal, check that the safety clevis pin is locked onto the brake servo pushrod by tilting it from the top downwards.
Incorrect adjustment of the pedal switches may cause premature wear of the brakes or clutch, or an injection system malfunction.
To ensure the correct operation of the switch, the notched rod must not be separated from the switch casing. Whenever the notched rod is completely removed, the switch must be replaced.
To prevent a loss of adjustment, replace the switch after three consecutive adjustments of the notched rod.
To prevent a malfunction (cruise control/speed limiter, starting function, braking function), the pedal switches must be replaced whenever they are removed.
To ensure the correct operation of the switch, the notched rod must not be separated from the switch casing. Whenever the notched rod is completely removed, the switch must be replaced.
Do not press or move the pedal during installation in order to avoid incorrect adjustment of the switch.
Do not press or move the pedal during disassembly in order to avoid damaging the switch.
Do not remove or fit the brake pedal switch if the brake pedal is not connected to the brake servo pushrod.
Do not remove or fit the clutch pedal switch if the clutch pedal is not connected to the clutch master cylinder.
